title: A highly unhelpful guide to Round Eleven
body_text:
The only guide to the round that admits it‚Äôs completely unhelpful. What it lacks in insight, it makes up for with wild theories and detours onto unrelated topics.
It‚Äôs your unhelpful guide to Round Eleven.
Friday
Sydney vs. Carlton (SCG) 7:50pm Seven/Fox
It‚Äôs early in the season, but the Carlton President has already come out and given his full support to Michael Voss.
You know Voss is in trouble then, and with Damien Hardwick out there, you just know the Blues will not be able to help themselves.
I‚Äôm not saying Hardwick is going to the Blues; I‚Äôm saying people involved with the Blues won‚Äôt be able to resist sounding him out and, in the process, destabilising the club.
Carlton can‚Äôt resist a saviour; fixing all their problem in one fell swoop is just too tempting for them.
This is the problem when you just think you should be on top rather than working for it. They are the trust fund baby of the league.
And to lose this would be a disaster. Sydney hasn‚Äôt exactly shot the lights out this season.
Last week, they only won because North Melbourne are numerically challenged.
While I wouldn‚Äôt put it past Carlton to stuff up basic maths, they used to do it all the time with the salary cap, the Swans can‚Äôt rely on that again.
To borrow from Kerry Packer speaking about Alan Bond ‚Äòyou only get one North Melbourne interchange debacle in your life.‚Äô
I‚Äôm tipping Carlton but hoping the Swans get it done as next week‚Äôs column will write itself.
Saturday
St Kilda vs. Hawthorn (Marvel) 1:45pm Fox Footy
The Hawks are having a nightmare off the field this season, but on the field, they are slightly less of a nightmare.
Last week, was a bit of a false positive. Beating the Eagles is like stealing candy from a baby, an inept and uncoordinated baby.
Still the Hawks have some good young players coming through, so there‚Äôs hope there.
When the Saints lost to Adelaide a fortnight ago, I imagine I wasn‚Äôt on my lonesome when I thought, ‚Äòhere we go again‚Äô.
But the Saints got things back on track against the Giants and now they get a week off to firm up those defensive drills.
The Saints other main priority is to make sure Max King doesn‚Äôt get injured again. I would be putting him in one of those Zorbs whenever he isn‚Äôt playing.
Sure, that will make it hard for him to have a life, but players shouldn‚Äôt have lives, they exist to perform for us.
Saints to win.
Melbourne vs. Fremantle (MCG) 2:10pm Fox Footy
Melbourne have a big reason to win this. Thanks to the Luke Jackson trade and the resulting movement of draft picks, a Fremantle loss is a win for Melbourne.
In recent weeks, what was looking like the deal of the century for the Dees has been coming back to a more even keel.
Jackson, and Fremantle have been improving significantly in recent weeks, they‚Äôve won three in a row.
And now they get a Melbourne side without Clayton Oliver.
That‚Äôs a big out. Oliver is the guy in the group assignment volunteering to do all the work. He‚Äôs the best player I‚Äôve ever seen in a Melbourne jumper.
After losing to the Power last week, the Demons can‚Äôt afford to drop this game, especially as Collingwood, Brisbane and Port seem to have forgotten how to lose.
A loss here and the Dees start looking like the Crows, or worse, Carlton.
The good news for the Dees, is this is at home, so it‚Äôs unlikely Brodie Grundy will shush the crowd.
We also get to see Max Gawn and Luke Jackson go against each other in this one.
Not since Darth Vader took on Obi-Wan Kenobi have I been so excited for a match-up.
I‚Äôm tipping Fremantle.
Geelong vs. Greater Western Sydney (GMHBA) 4:35pm Fox Footy
Geelong‚Äôs injury list is painful to read.
Cam Guthrie (toe), Max Holmes (knee), Sam De Koning (face), Gary Rohan (hamstring), Cameron Mooney (KO‚Äôd), Rhys Stanley (eye), Ollie Henry (testicle), Mitch Duncan (hamstring), Jack Bowes (calf) and Jhye Clark (foot).
Ollie Henry‚Äôs injury is particularly eye-watering. I can‚Äôt think of many circumstances were having your name and ‚Äòtesticle‚Äô in the media is a good thing.
It‚Äôs either a painful incident or you‚Äôve done something you shouldn‚Äôt have in the workplace.
The injury woes have led to the Cats dropping their last two games, but losing down in Geelong is not something they often do.
The Giants have been competitive this season, while managing to dodge victory, like a matador avoiding a bull.
The result is their better than the bottom three teams but that‚Äôs about it.
I‚Äôm tipping Geelong.
Gold Coast vs. Western Bulldogs (TIO) 7:25pm Seven/Fox
The Bulldogs travel into the heart of Suns territory, Darwin.
Considering they played in Ballarat last week, that‚Äôs quite the gear shift.
It does show you that playing AFL takes you to all the great cities of the world.
In recent weeks, the Doggies have been on fire, smashing the Crows last week and now they get the Gold Coast.
I relate to the Suns. They remind me of what every teacher wrote on my report card, ‚Äòhas not lived up to his potential.‚Äô
Well, the joke now is on those teachers, I‚Äôve proved I just didn‚Äôt have any potential.
The Suns have been in the news with Hardwick retiring, with the media asking Stuart Dew if he felt this put pressure on him.
I don‚Äôt think he should worry; I can‚Äôt think of any occasions where a club have ruthlessly sacked someone just to get a premiership coach.
I‚Äôm tipping the Suns.
West Coast vs. Essendon (Optus) 7:30pm Fox Footy
There are no words to describe how bad I am at golf.
Driving the ball, chipping, putting, any who have witnessed me doing these have said later it was the worst thing they‚Äôve ever seen, bordering on the traumatic.
Once at the driving range, I teed off and somehow hit it behind me and broke a window, narrowly missing several people.
The staff came and physically removed the club from my hand and banned me from the premises.
They said I was a danger to myself and everyone else.
This is all to say, I am still better at golf than the Eagles are at Australian Rules Football.
The news broke this week that Essendon has brought in a medical specialist to help with their injury problems.
Now while more jokes than I could fit on the internet come to mind, I would have thought the club would already have this.
Isn‚Äôt preventing injuries part of the medical and fitness departments job?
To my knowledge, only the Eagles actively try to injure their players.
I‚Äôm tipping the Bombers.
Sunday
Richmond vs. Port Adelaide (MCG) 1:10pm Fox Footy
A bit on at Tigerland this week, with Damien Hardwick announcing he‚Äôs leaving.
Not since Zayn left One Direction has such a move shaken a group of men to its core.
Hardwick led Richmond to three premierships and was a big part of rebuilding the club into a powerhouse, but apart from that he didn‚Äôt do much.
Andrew McQualter now steps in as the interim coach, and Dimma has given him some advice ‚Äòbe yourself.‚Äô
This is terrible advice. I spent a lot of time being myself and it led me to being friendless, loveless and with several injunctions.
My advice? Be Paul Rudd. The guy is charming, and he just doesn‚Äôt age. Men and women like him, and he was in Clueless which is a classic and still stands up.
Port will be disappointed to be facing the Tigers after their coach has left, although usually, a team lifts because a coach has been sacked.
In this case, the coach sacked the team, but that‚Äôs not as motivating.
David King has predicted this week that Damien Hardwick will be the coach of Port Adelaide in 2024.
So, you can be assured he won‚Äôt be coach of Port Adelaide next year.
I‚Äôm tipping the Power.
Collingwood vs. North Melbourne (Marvel) 3:20pm Seven/Fox
Is this even legal? It feels like it shouldn‚Äôt be.
Are we going to have adults fighting children next? Lions vs Christians?
The only way I could see the Pies losing this one, is if North Melbourne managed to change the sport to netball.
Personally, I enjoyed watching the Pies lose across various codes. The question now is, will Collingwood drop their badminton team?
One bit of good news is Tarryn Thomas has been cleared to make his AFL return and Brett Ratten says he‚Äôs ‚Äúpretty close‚Äù to be picked.
It‚Äôs just great to see an AFL player get a second third fourth fifth sixth seventh eighth chance.
And it‚Äôs not like the AFL hasn‚Äôt been banging on about respecting women, and how they take all this stuff seriously, so there‚Äôs no hypocrisy in letting him back into the game.
If he was a rubbish player, they would have dumped him months ago. North can play him all they want; they just can‚Äôt swing around and grab the high moral ground in the future. Oh, and it‚Äôs a disgrace.
I‚Äôm tipping the Pies.
Adelaide vs. Brisbane (AO) 4:40pm Fox Footy
Adelaide were awful last week, and now they face the Lions, who are building nicely.
Joe Daniher is playing well, and he is like the canary in the coal mine. If Joe is up and about, so are the Lions.
If he‚Äôs asleep at the bottom of his cage, get out of the mine because dangerous gases such as carbon monoxide are building up.
Wait, I don‚Äôt think the analogy stretches that far.
The Lions have now won seven in a row, the Crows have not.
They do get Taylor Walker and possibly Riley Thilthorpe, which they need, given they kicked just five goals last week.
Brodie Smith is in doubt, as he is suffering from the most relatable injury ever ‚Äògeneral soreness‚Äô.
I always suffer from general soreness. It happens as you get older. I can injure myself while lying in bed, not moving.
Next time someone asks, ‚Äòhow are you going?‚Äô just say ‚Äògeneral soreness.‚Äô
I‚Äôm tipping the Lions.
You can help support me in producing this ridiculous nonsense I churn out on a regular basis. Find out more here: https://titusoreily.com/support-titus
COMMENTS
May 26, 2023
the 'potential' gag made me cry - both ways
May 26, 2023
"I‚Äôm tipping Fremantle."
Thank you. Thank you. Thank you. Thank you.
With your tip locked in, I can now safely place all my current savings, future savings, house, and first born child on Melbourne winning this match.
May 26, 2023
"I can‚Äôt think of many circumstances were..."
"The result is their better..."
Oh Titus. Didn't the teachers at St Aloysius Boys' School for the Overly Privileged teach you the difference between their/they're and were/where?
May 26, 2023
General soreness should be one of the options on the Application for Leave form at every workplace.
May 26, 2023
FMD - tipping Fremantle? Is this some kind of reverse psychology? For the love of all that is good in üíú & carries the sufficient burden of an ‚öìÔ∏è, please don‚Äôt mess with my head. Bring back real Titus.
May 26, 2023
Very pretty brilliant, Titus. Love your ‚Äúsatire not really satire but still satirical‚Äù take. But take exception to the ‚Äúhere we go again‚Äù thought when StK lost badly to Adelaide. You‚Äôve turned something deeply spiritual, to all StK supporters, into something almost dismissive.
Cameron Mooney being out injured KO‚Äôd is an interesting one. According to boxing rules, he has to be out for at least one month. According to AFL rules, he has to be out for at least 12 days. A tricky one for sporting authorities. Where‚Äôs John Douglas when you need him?
May 26, 2023
Will Collingwood drop their badminton side literally made me laugh out loud!
May 26, 2023
Turn it up Titus ... What do you know about babies ... that'll own babies with an addiction to Ripe Raspberries?? Con
May 26, 2023
At least hamstring awareness is specific; general soreness not so much. In hockey at least we have lower or upper body injury.
May 26, 2023
Liked your Geelong injuries bit, leaving out Dangerfield was special. Geelong are my 18th favourite team too.
May 26, 2023
General Sorness üòÇüòÇüòÇ
May 26, 2023
Titus how very deviously clever of yourself reprising Lou's Kiss of Death on old town 'Freo'. Blink! next round you shall be dusting off the cobwebs, checking the oil and other essential fluids on the vintage Rolls in the O'Reily garage plus brushing up the eyebrows for the annual pilgrimage to Princess Park. Bob's your uncle. Too bad it's been renamed Visy Park, the ramp's been removed and replaced by a monolithic lump of Kubrick. Demon's to win.
May 26, 2023
Some years ago my name and the word "testicle" were mentioned in the same sentence in the media. Local news only, though.
It was in connection with that unfortunate incident with the mayor of Devonport's wife. I'm still not permitted to divulge the details. I can only say that at the time of the incident it was getting dark and there was a COMPLETELY UNDERSTANDABLE misunderstanding on my part (in both senses of the word).
May 26, 2023
Hamstring strains and general body soreness are both legit reasons to take time off work. Used to play footy on a Sunday arvo, and took plenty of Monday‚Äôs off with general body soreness. Did a hammy big time and took 3 days off. Couldn‚Äôt reasonably be expected to walk to catch public transport. And not safe to drive a car. The GP I visited signed the sick certificate so all above board. Bit of a hassle getting the sick certificate‚Äîhad to drive through peak traffic and couldn‚Äôt find a park nearby, so a 10 minute walk.
May 26, 2023
WHY TITUS REALLY CHOSE THE SUNS
TO BEAT THE BULLDOGS IN DARWIN
The shorter the flight
The stronger the bite.
By Saturday night
We'll know if he's right.
May 26, 2023
You think you're bad at golf, Titus? Whenever I play golf I only get to hit the ball 18 times, and on each occasion it disappears into a hole in the ground about the size of a tin of beans. Everyone else gets to hit the ball heaps of times.
Nunawading is lovely in June-
might have to visit there soon.
They're literary folks,
with their limericks and jokes,
but none can outshine the Full Moon.
May 26, 2023
Keep up the poetry Gents. Elevates an already brilliant read.
May 26, 2023
Wow, Cameron Mooney is 43 years old and retired in 2011. Geelong are in deep shite if they expecting him to come back into the side.
May 26, 2023
With reference to "one fell swoop" - while that is the correct term, when talking about Carlton the oft-quoted "one foul swoop" is actually more appropriate.
I also note, without comment, that the Carlton President was the CEO of PwC during the period now under some discussion in political circles. Still, with a past No.1 ticket holder list like Robert Menzies, Malcolm Fraser, John Elliott and Josh Frydenberg, they are used to political circles at Princes Park.
May 26, 2023
Didn‚Äôt you see Robbie Flower ? !!
May 26, 2023
@ JON HOLMES
Good point.
His memory does seem to be pretty selective sometimes.
A while ago he mocked the white headband that Aoron Naughton wears. When I read that I immediately thought "Heavens to Carl Ditterich!"
May 26, 2023
‚Äò‚Ä¶the trust fund baby of the league‚Äô.
So true, and so many years still to atone for the Elliot era.
May 26, 2023
West Coast sees the Geelong injury list and laughs in pitiful sobs. Except for Dom Sheed, his near fatal career threatening thorax injury hasn‚Äôt fully recovered.
May 26, 2023
Excuse me sir! We‚Äôre the pokie-less, community outreach, slightly less rapey, Caroline Wilson-loving Roos! We‚Äôll take the moral high ground anytime we damn well please.
May 26, 2023
I just had a look at the fixture and it looks like the Pies have 3 byes in the next 4 rounds. Lucky the Daicos‚Äô can have a lively 3 way kick to kick at home in the backyard to stay sharp.
May 27, 2023
Titus, the best player in a Melbourne jumper was one R Flower. I saw him single handedly towel up the tigers and we had great wingers too!
May 27, 2023
I lost money betting on Carlton last night, but still enjoyed the game immensely. All the way through the aftermath of the Essington 'supplements' scandal, one thing brought me comfort: the Blues are a basket case. David Teague? Oh, stop, I'm laughing too hard...
May 27, 2023
Oh, and please stop correcting TO's abysmal grammar. It's part of the charm.
May 27, 2023
Abysmal grammar is definitely part of TO's charm. We just have to hope he never gets the idea that the more abysmal it gets the more charming it gets.
May 27, 2023
One of the funniest men in the world lmfao üòÇ
May 29, 2023
Very cynical of you to tip Freo, Tittus. However the footy gods frown on this sort of thing and they gave you your comeuppance.
Loved the write-up on Carlton. Can't wait for the MKNR.
Loved the poetry and the comment from G Train about the Sainters' souls. It's only 1hr 27 min from Nunawading to Elsternwick by pushbike.
Couldn't resist checking and the (current) Mayor of Davenport doesn't have a wife, only a partner called Pete. So I confidently infer your testicle incident happened a while back TEBS. I hope the testicle in question is back in good working order.
May 29, 2023
And now everyone's wishing we copied his tips.
(I tipped Freo, Port, Pies and Dons, so almost.)
